title: The end of US assistance leads to an 'unprecedented' crisis in aid to displaced people
summary: Heavily dependent on American funding, UN agencies providing aid to refugees and migrants are discontinuing several programs.

title: Femicide: French court sentences man who burned his wife alive to life in prison
summary: The man stalked and killed his 31-year-old wife in 2021, after their separation. The case shocked the country and sparked criticism of police for failing to protect her.

title: Tariffs: Europeans are open to negotiations with Donald Trump without conditions
summary: From their initial contacts with the US administration, European negotiators are convinced that the battle over tariffs is going to be tough. A worried Commission still hopes to find a negotiated solution.

title: Violent earthquake hits Thailand and Myanmar, killing at least 144
summary: A skyscraper under construction in Bangkok collapsed into a cloud of dust as a 7.7 magnitude earthquake rocked southeast Asia on Friday. At least 144 people have been killed in Myanmar.

title: In Jerusalem, Jordan Bardella rubs shoulders with the reactionary international
summary: On a trip to Israel on March 26 and 27, Marine Le Pen's lieutenant took part in a conference on anti-Semitism attended by Benjamin Netanyahu and supporters of Donald Trump.

title: White House struggles to untangle its contradictions in 'Signalgate' scandal
summary: Four days after revelations in 'The Atlantic' proved that top government officials had been texting sensitive information about strikes on the Houthis in Yemen, the scandal doesn't seem to be dying down.

title: Tension over water on the US-Mexico border
summary: The Trump administration has refused to send water from the Colorado River to drought-stricken Tijuana. It is seeking to force the Mexican government to add more water into the Rio Bravo.

title: Wisconsin AG sues Elon Musk to block $1 million payment offers to voters
summary: Attorney General Josh Kaul filed a lawsuit to stop Musk from making payments, after the billionaire promised $1 million checks to voters this weekend, just days before a contested Supreme Court race.

title: Federal judge blocks Trump from firing 1,200 Voice of America staff
summary: A federal judge on Friday halted the Trump administration's efforts to dismantle the eight-decade-old US government-funded international news service, calling the move a 'classic case of arbitrary and capricious decision making.'

title: Haiti, the poorest nation in the Americas, sees worsening crisis as gangs gain ground
summary: UN rights chief Volker Turk cited reports, Friday, estimating that between 270,000 and 500,000 firearms were circulating illegally in Haiti, with most weapons in the hands of gangs.

title: US VP Vance says Denmark has 'under invested' in Greenland
summary: JD Vance made his comment during a trip to the Pituffik Space Base in northwestern Greenland, a visit viewed by Copenhagen and Nuuk as a provocation.

title: Putin plays for time against Trump in Ukraine talks
summary: Moscow has succeeded in imposing its tempo on Washington, all while continuing its offensive against Ukraine and blaming Europe for the breakdown in negotiations.

title: In photos: Powerful earthquake hits Myanmar and Thailand
summary: Numerous injuries and damage were reported in Naypyidaw and Bangkok, the capitals of Myanmar and Thailand.

title: US tariffs are at their highest levels since 1945, jolting global economy
summary: US tariffs on imported products have quadrupled in two months, reaching 10%, estimates the rating agency Fitch. Global growth is set to slow sharply.

title: Paris summit yields no clarity on potential deployment of European troops in Ukraine
summary: Speaking at a meeting of the 'coalition of the willing' in Paris on Thursday, French President Emmanuel Macron acknowledged that the plan to send soldiers to Ukraine was 'not unanimously supported.' Especially as a ceasefire remains elusive.

title: Elon Musk sells X to his AI company
summary: Musk said in a post on X that the $33 billion all-stock deal will 'unlock immense potential.'

title: Greenland parties agree on broad coalition government
summary: Four of the five parties represented in Parliament will be part of the coalition, excluding only the ultra-nationalists. The agreement was announced hours before US Vice President JD Vance's arrival on an uninvited visit.

summary: On Friday, the US vice president was scheduled to visit the only remaining US military base in Greenland. Its history has been peppered with controversy, fueling locals' grievances against Copenhagen.

title: Film academy apologizes for lack of support to 'No Other Land' Palestinian co-director after he was attacked
summary: Hamdan Ballal said he had been assaulted by settlers and detained at gunpoint by soldiers in the Israeli-occupied West Bank. Unlike multiple other prominent filmmaker groups, the Academy of Motion Picture initially did not issue a statement.

title: Masculinism: 'The series Adolescence reflects reality, with all that's bad about it'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, researcher Stephanie Lamy explains that the highly successful Netflix series aptly exposes the various mechanisms at work in the spread of misogynist violence.

title: In Myanmar, junta says at least 694 are dead, 1,670 injured after powerful earthquake in Myanmar
summary: A 7.7 earthquake devastated one of the poorest countries in the world on Friday. In neighboring Thailand, at least six died in Bangkok, where a high-rise under construction collapsed.

title: Georges Bizet Festival presents little-known works by author of 'Carmen'
summary: The event celebrating the 150th anniversary of the composer's death will take place at the Villa Viardot outside Paris from March 29 to April 6, with a world premiere of melodies and early opera.

title: Germany, abandoned by its American protector, prepares to take defense into its own hands
summary: 'Europeans, war and peace' (Part 3 of 7). In Germany, only the radical left and the far right continue to claim a pacifism that was once widely shared.

title: In Canada, a 'good parent' goes outside with his child no matter the weather
summary: Freezing winter or not, 'influencer' parents are posting pictures of their children on skis, smiling in front of splendid landscapes. An incentive to participate in outdoor activities.

title: UK's Tate Britain gallery will return painting to heirs after it was stolen by Nazi during WWII
summary: A handover date has not yet been confirmed but Samuel Hartveld's family said they were 'deeply grateful.'

title: 'Signalgate': Why the scandal revealed by The Atlantic raises cybersecurity questions
summary: The editor-in-chief of The Atlantic was accidentally invited into a group chat with high-ranking US officials. This has since sparked a controversy about the way they share sensitive information.

title: In Greenland, JD Vance attacks Denmark but rules out military option
summary: During a visit lasting just a few hours to the American military base at Pituffik, the American vice president expressed his hope that Greenland would soon become independent and choose to come under the American 'security umbrella.'

title: Incredibly 'confusing and chaotic' situation for climate science in the US
summary: The Trump administration's attacks on environmental protections and climate science, though contested and sometimes overturned by the courts, have been continuing, jeopardizing data collection and storage.

title: French companies shocked by letter from US embassy in Paris demanding they respect Trump's anti-diversity policy
summary: The US embassy sent a letter to a number of French companies demanding that they comply with the Trump administration's 'anti-DEI' policy if they want any contracts with the US federal government.

title: 'Black Paris' exhibition at the Centre Pompidou fills key gaps in our history
summary: The works of 150 African, African American and Caribbean artists, most of them little-known, are on show at the Paris museum. Long overdue recognition.

title: Hundreds of thousands protest in Turkey to defend democracy
summary: The arrest of the mayor of Istanbul on March 19 sparked an unprecedented wave of protests across the country.

title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky backed into corner by US's new version of draft mineral agreement
summary: The outline of an 'economic partnership' proposed by the Trump administration appears to amount to a full-scale submission by Ukraine, transferring rights over all its resources and infrastructure.

summary: Whether it's Georgian khinkali, Chinese guotie or Ukrainian varenyky, the French capital offers a world tour of various ingredients cooked in dough.

title: In the Bahamas and Turks and Caicos Islands, Starship rockets create new pollution
summary: Their debris, which falls back into the sea and onto land, generates large quantities of waste, with as yet unknown environmental consequences. But, due to donations from private companies like SpaceX, local governments have shown leniency.

summary: The artist mixes silkscreen, acrylic paint, digital printing, embroidery and feathers in works on display at the Palais de Tokyo in Paris that evoke figures from the West Indies to arouse curiosity and raise questions.

summary: Bill Pallot, an undisputed specialist in 18th-century French furniture, and Bruno Desnoues, an expert cabinetmaker, explained before the French court how they had managed to fool the experts, revealing the art world's side dealings in the process.

summary: Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad's dictatorship, Damascus residents have been flocking to this iconic, century-old ice cream parlor in the heart of the capital. The pleasure, with a taste of freedom, comes at a high price in a country with a stricken economy.

title: What is celebrated on Eid al-Fitr?
summary: On Sunday, Muslims celebrate the end of the fasting practiced during the month of Ramadan.

title: American woman held in Afghanistan by the Taliban has been released
summary: Faye Dail Hall, who was detained in February on charges of using a drone without authorization, was released as part of a deal that Qatari negotiators helped broker.

title: Wes Anderson's childhood memories explored in Paris exhibition
summary: The Cinémathèque Française hosts a dynamic exhibition showcasing the playful universe of the American director.
